subject: Re: [junit] How can parameterized tests be run with ant?
msgSnippet: ... Are you running the class that has the custom suite() method on it?  should find those tests and run them instead of looking for test*() methods.
messageBody:
jewellgm wrote:
> Hi All,
>
> I created a parameterized test using the pattern discussed in a recent
> thread. Now that I've got that up and running, I'd like to generate
> HTML reports of the results.
>
> However, since there are any typical "test" methods in the class,
> the "junit" task in ant now fails.
>
> Is there an existing workaround/solution to this?

Are you running the class that has the custom suite() method on it?
<junit> should find those tests and run them instead of looking for
test*() methods.

Can you show us your Ant task and where it's failing?
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
